intro: Helichrysum diosmifolium, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that remain vibrant even after drying. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Helichrysum diosmifolium is a perennial herb that produces small, yellow-orange blooms throughout the growing season.
